image.altText: Dinush Kurera walks out of a prison van, wearing a black jacket.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man who killed his wife with a knife and an axe has been found guilty of murder, with a Supreme Court jury rejecting his story that he was acting in self-defence.

title.children: Melbourne man who killed his wife with a knife and axe found guilty of murder

image.altText: Crane on Melbourne construction site at sunrise

props.synopsis: The Victorian government probe was commissioned after allegations surfaced of bullying and intimidation within the construction branch of the embattled union.

title.children: Construction workers scared to blow whistle due to 'fear of reprisal', government investigation finds

image.altText: Singer Robbie Williams dressed in all one colour raises his arms in the air as he performs at the AFL Grand Final at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Supreme Court found grand prix organisers misled a music touring company about messages received from then-chief health officer Brett Sutton during the pandemic.

title.children: Australian Grand Prix ordered to pay $2.8m to Robbie Williams promoter over concert cancelled by COVID

image.altText: David Holmes, looking unhappy, leans on the back of a chair

props.synopsis: After a couple of years working at Southern Cross Station, elevator mechanic David Holmes says he struggled to exercise, was constantly tired and realised his skin was turning yellow.

title.children: When David left work at Southern Cross Station, he says diesel fumes would 'ooze' from his skin

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a stern expression on his face as he sits in the House of Reps

props.synopsis: The prime minister overturns a decision earlier this week to omit a new question on sexuality being added to the national census, after several Labor MPs spoke out against the move.

title.children: Albanese backs down on decision to exclude LGBT question from next census

image.altText: Rory Amon

props.synopsis: Rory Amon is accused of five counts of sexual intercourse with a person between 10 and 14 and two counts of attempting sexual intercourse with a person between 10 and 14.

title.children: Sydney MP Rory Amon quits Liberal Party after being charged with child sex offences

image.altText: Police and paramedics in toilet area with stretcher

props.synopsis: Police say the man was found with a wound to his chest inside the toilets at the centre today, adding there is no threat to the public. He was rushed to hospital in a critical condition.

title.children: Man fights for life after stabbing at Gold Coast shopping centre

image.altText: A roll of barbed wire atop a prison wall at night.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old boy takes his own life inside WA's controversial Banksia Hill, becoming the second child to die in youth detention in the state in less than a year.

title.children: Teenage boy dies by suicide inside Banksia Hill, second child to die in WA youth detention in less than a year

image.altText: Dr Javeria Jalal looking at the camera. She is sitting in her home with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Nine maths teachers — seven women and two men — are set to lose their jobs at the University of Melbourne. Three women are taking the case to the state human rights commission alleging gender discrimination.

title.children: A university teacher returned to work four weeks after an emergency c-section. Now she's facing the axe from her employer

image.altText: Workers harvesting cauliflower in the early morning on a farm at Werribee.

props.synopsis: Prices for some vegetables are falling because of oversupply, but there are concerns for the livestock industry as Queensland's soaring temperatures dry pasture and feed.

title.children: Record warm temperatures mean cheaper winter veggies but less feed for livestock

image.altText: A small boy with tears in his eyes is held by his mother as a doctor works at a desk behind him

props.synopsis: The Israeli military and Palestinian militant group have agreed to pause fighting over three separate periods to allow WHO staff to vaccinate children for polio across the besieged enclave.

title.children: Israel and Hamas agree to three-day pauses in hostilities for Gaza polio campaign

image.altText: A St Kilda AFLW player rises high above a group of Fremantle players to reach for the ball.

props.synopsis: As the AFLW season gets underway, who is set to have a breakthrough season, a great debut season or get back to their best? Gemma Bastiani runs the rule over all 18 clubs.

title.children: Your club's player to watch in the 2024 AFLW season

image.altText: A woman looks past the camera, smiling

props.synopsis: No criminal charges will be laid over Veronica Nelson's cruel and preventable death in a Victorian prison, after the state's workplace safety watchdog declared there was "insufficient evidence" to prosecute justice officials or a prison healthcare provider.

title.children: No charges to be laid over Veronica Nelson's 'harrowing' death in Victorian prison cell

image.altText: A man in a black shirt leans over a rail and looks out into the distance. He is standing on a boat docked in the river.

props.synopsis: The State Emergency Service has responded to a number of marine rescue call-outs on the River Murray in the last fortnight.

title.children: Houseboats getting stuck in River Murray threaten multi-million-dollar tourism industry

image.altText: A phone inside a mug that says 'have a nice day'.

props.synopsis: On December 12, 2022, three innocent people were ambushed by extremists and murdered in cold blood in a country Queensland town. Why it occurred may never be fully understood.

title.children: It started as a routine police call. By the end of the night, six people were dead

image.altText: seven-network-journalist-robert-ovadia delivers the news as he looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Robert Ovadia have argued that the behaviour, which included sending a photo of a flaccid penis from the internet, was not sexual harassment and that his dismissal was unlawful.

title.children: Sacked Seven journalist dismisses complaints, denies behaviour was sexual harassment

image.altText: A baby in hospital with burns.

props.synopsis: A baby boy burned after coffee was poured on him in a random attack at a Brisbane park will have surgery today to help determine the extent of his injuries.

title.children: Baby boy burned in hot coffee attack to undergo surgery as search for suspect continues

image.altText: Two female students kneel next to a merino sheep while outside.

props.synopsis: School students are thinking seriously about a career in agriculture after spending the past six months working to get their sheep into tip-top shape.

title.children: Working to get sheep into competition shape hooks teenagers on farming

image.altText: A dentist attends to a patient at an RFDS dental clinic

props.synopsis: Dental healthcare gets left on the back burner for Australians who can't afford day-to-day costs, as patients who rely on public dental care face lengthy wait times.

title.children: Taking loans to fix teeth, choosing to make rent over dentist fees. Australians reveal true toll of dental care neglect

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles with a man behind her

props.synopsis: The stakes for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz were high as they sat down with CNN for their first interview since Joe Biden stepped aside. These were the biggest moments.

title.children: It's no secret Kamala Harris hates interviews. These were the big moments from her sit-down with CNN

image.altText: A silhouette shows graduate students wearing gowns and hats.

props.synopsis: Some of Australia's most prestigious universities have offered 2025 places to international students that are now uncertain under new caps to be imposed by the federal government.

title.children: International student offers have already gone out, but unis don't yet know how many they can enrol

image.altText: Marcus Bontempelli poses with a trophy after being announced as the Most Valuable Player of the AFL

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs champion Marcus Bontempelli has been named All-Australian captain as Melbourne ruck star Max Gawn joined an elite group of players with his seventh selection in the team of the year.

title.children: Bontempelli named All-Australian captain as Gawn joins elite AFL class

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: Once perceived as the glittering symbol of city sophistication, Australia's biggest listed casino group has found itself reduced to the status of last chance saloon.

title.children: Fallen Star: Why Australia's gaming giant is hanging by a thread

image.altText: Sheets of metal are wrapped round a powerline in the middle of several houses

props.synopsis: The storm has caused the death of three people as it moves towards central Japan including the capital Tokyo.

title.children: Typhoon Shanshan forces millions to evacuate as damage intensifies

image.altText: Michael Hughes sitting in a restaurant, smiling to the camera and clasping his hands together.

props.synopsis: Michael Hughes had always imagined being a dad, but it didn't eventuate for him. Father's Day is especially painful, as it was the day his wife had a miscarriage almost two decades ago.

title.children: 'I always imagined I would be a dad': Father's Day when you're childless not by choice

image.altText: NAB chief executive Andrew Irvine speaks into a microphone at a parliamentary committee.

props.synopsis: NAB tells a parliamentary hearing that "scams are the plague of our time" after answering a range of questions. The Australian share market has opened higher. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters.

title.children: NAB describes scams as 'plague of our times' at parliamentary hearing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: No growth in retail spending in July
NAB: crypto-currency is a 'very high risk for our customers'
Australian share market is up in early trading session

image.altText: A drone shot shows rows of flooded streets with two people standing in the flooded water, covered up to their knees.

props.synopsis: Almost 2,000 people have been rescued, with the army deployed to assist with relief efforts.

title.children: Dozens killed in India as heavy rain leads to widespread flooding

image.altText: Bridget Flack is pictured with flasses and curly hair and a small smile at the camera

props.synopsis: Coroner Ingrid Giles' investigation into the deaths of five transgender women heard gender-diverse people had "a myriad of horror stories" about their experiences of healthcare, and she's recommended urgent changes as a result.

title.children: Victorian coroner recommends more improvements in trans health care following investigation into five deaths

image.altText: An artist's impression of the proposed development at Port Douglas.

props.synopsis: When Australian investors tipped millions into a large investment fund, they probably didn't expect it would go towards an event with boxer Floyd Mayweather or a penthouse for the wife of a property developer whose fortunes are tied to the fund. But that's exactly what the corporate watchdog has alleged.

title.children: Corporate watchdog claims investment money may have been used to buy $4.5m penthouse for developer's wife

image.altText: Mattijs Bellers of Netherlands in action against Frank Ponder of Australia

props.synopsis: The Rollers — two-time Paralympic gold medallists — lose to the Netherlands in wheelchair basketball in the final event on day one in Paris, as Australia wins its first gold of the Games in the pool.

title.children: Rollers have tough start to Paralympic campaign after para-swimmers begin medal haul on day one

image.altText: A collage of three different news stories

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz:  Hamish Blake's life-changing advice, Paralympics begin, and rumours at the DNC

image.altText: A supermarket worker putting up a sign in Japanese on a rice shelf.

props.synopsis: Japanese supermarkets across the country have run out of rice stocks, with consumer stockpiling at least partly to blame. So what can be done about it?

title.children: Japan is running out of rice. Why are consumers panic-buying?
